description: Today's links Foxx Nolte's "Hidden History of Walt Disney World": The rough edges are more interesting than the polished surfaces. Hey look at this: Delights to delectate. This day in history: 2004, 2009, 2014, 2019, 2024 Upcoming appearances: Where to find me. Recent appearances: Where I've been. Latest books: You keep readin' em, I'll keep writin' 'em. Upcoming books: Like I said, I'll keep writin' 'em. Colophon: All the rest. Foxx Nolte's "Hidden History of Walt Disney World" (permalink) No one writes about Disney theme parks like Foxx Nolte; no one rises above the trivia and goes beyond the mere sleuthing of historical facts, no one nails the essence of what makes these parks work – and fail. I first encountered Nolte through her blog, Passport to Dreams Old and New, where her writing transformed the way I viewed the project of these giant, elaborate built environments. It was through articles like this one – about the sightlines from bathrooms! – that I came to
title: Pluralistic: Foxx Nolte's "Hidden History of Walt Disney World" (15 Jul 2024)
